main event: A bright, circular object approximately 100 feet in diameter was observed hovering 50-75 feet above a rural area in Groveton, Missouri on the evening of February 9, 1968.
interesting points: The object emitted a bright glow, providing enough light for the observer to see details in the surrounding pasture.
The object had bright lights around its circumference that blinked on and off in a sequence.
The object made no sound and there was no visible sign of propulsion.
After about 10 minutes of observation, the object suddenly accelerated at a very high speed and disappeared.
The observer, a 57-year-old man, was shaken by the experience but otherwise unharmed.
sighted object: a large, circular craft with bright lights
